message.content: Read .scaffold_context and app_metadata.json. Analyze data, decide UI paradigm in 1-2 sentences, then implement directly. Follow .claude/skills/frontend-impl/SKILL.md. Use existing types and services from src/types/ and src/services/. Deploy when done using the deploy_to_github tool.

1→---
     2→name: frontend-impl
     3→description: |
     4→  Activate this skill when:
     5→  - Building DashboardOverview.tsx
     6→  - Writing React/TypeScript code
     7→  - Integrating with Living Apps API
     8→allowed-tools:
     9→  - Read
    10→  - Write
    11→  - Edit
    12→  - Bash
    13→  - Glob
    14→  - Grep
    15→---
    16→
    17→# Frontend Implementation Skill
    18→
    19→Build a **production-ready, domain-specific dashboard** as the app's primary workspace.
    20→
    21→---
    22→
    23→## Step 1: Analyze and Decide (MANDATORY — before any code)
    24→
    25→Read `.scaffold_context` and `app_metadata.json`. Then write 1-2 sentences describing:
    26→
    27→1. **What is the best UI paradigm for the user's core workflow?**
    28→2. **Why is this the most natural way to interact with THIS data?**
    29→
    30→Use this table to guide your choice:
    31→
    32→| Data Nature | Best UI Paradigm |
    33→|-------------|-----------------|
    34→| Time-based / scheduled entries | Calendar, week planner, timeline |
    35→| Status-based / workflow stages | Kanban board, progress pipeline |
    36→| Quantitative / goal-tracking | Progress rings, gauges, trend charts |
    37→| Hierarchical / categorized | Grouped sections, nested views |
    38→| Sequential / step-by-step | Stepper, checklist, flow view |
    39→| Relational / many linked items | Master-detail, linked cards |
    40→
    41→Then implement immediately. No design_brief.md, no task lists, no planning documents.
    42→
    43→---
    44→
    45→## Step 2: Edit index.css (design tokens)
    46→
    47→**Use Edit, NOT Write** — `index.css` is pre-generated with correct import order.
    48→
    49→Choose a font and color palette that fits the app's domain, then add your tokens:
    50→
    51→```css
    52→@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=...');  /* URL imports FIRST */
    53→@import "tailwindcss";
    54→@import "tw-animate-css";
    55→
    56→/* EXTEND :root — do NOT rewrite */
    57→:root {
    58→  --background: oklch(...);
    59→  --foreground: oklch(...);
    60→  --card: oklch(...);
    61→  --primary: oklch(...);
    62→  /* ... */
    63→  --gradient-primary: linear-gradient(135deg, oklch(...), oklch(...));
    64→  --shadow-elegant: 0 10px 30px -10px oklch(... / 0.3);
    65→}
    66→```
    67→
    68→**CSS Import Order MUST stay intact:** `@import url(...)` FIRST, then `@import "tailwindcss"`, then `@import "tw-animate-css"`.
    69→
    70→## Step 3: Edit Layout.tsx (title only)
    71→
    72→Use Edit to change `APP_TITLE` and `APP_SUBTITLE`. Nothing else.
    73→
    74→## Step 4: Write DashboardOverview.tsx
    75→
    76→Plan the ENTIRE component, then Write it ONCE. You MAY create additional files in `src/components/` for complex interactive components.
    77→
    78→## Step 5: Deploy
    79→
    80→```bash
    81→npm run build
    82→```
    83→
    84→Then call `mcp__deploy_tools__deploy_to_github`
    85→
    86→---
    87→
    88→## What Is Pre-Generated (DO NOT touch!)
    89→
    90→CRUD sub-pages, dialogs, routing, sidebar, and shared components are pre-generated. Changing CSS variables in `index.css` automatically updates their appearance.
    91→
    92→**DO NOT touch:** CRUD pages, dialogs, App.tsx, PageShell.tsx, StatCard.tsx, ConfirmDialog.tsx.
    93→
    94→---
    95→
    96→## Dashboard = Primary Workspace, NOT Info Page
    97→
    98→**The #1 mistake is building the dashboard as a passive info screen** (KPI cards + chart + recent activity). Users want to WORK with their data, not just look at it.
    99→
   100→### The Core Interactive Component
   101→
   102→Every dashboard needs ONE interactive component — the **reason users open the app**. This component:
   103→
   104→- Takes up significant screen space (hero, not sidebar widget)
   105→- Supports create, edit, delete directly (click empty slot → create dialog, click entry → edit)
   106→- Shows data in its most natural form (the paradigm you chose in Step 1)
   107→- Provides immediate visual feedback
   108→
   109→The pre-generated CRUD list pages are a fallback. Users should do 90% of their work without leaving the dashboard.
   110→
   111→### Anti-Slop Checklist (if ANY true, redesign!)
   112→
   113→- Dashboard is a passive info page — only KPI cards and charts
   114→- No domain-specific UI — uses generic list/table for core data
   115→- All KPI cards look identical
   116→- Layout is a boring 2x2 or 3x3 grid
   117→- No clear hero element
   118→- Colors are generic blue/green/red
   119→- Dashboard could be for ANY app
   120→- Font is Inter, Roboto, Open Sans, Lato, Arial, Helvetica, or system-ui
   121→
   122→---
   123→
   124→## Design Principles (apply inline, no separate document)
   125→
   126→### Theme: Light, Minimal, BUT Distinctive
   127→
   128→Always light mode. Minimal does NOT mean generic.
   129→
   130→**Color:** Start with warm or cool off-white base (not pure white). Add ONE refined accent color that fits the app's domain — not generic blue (#007bff).
   131→
   132→**Typography:** FORBIDDEN: Inter, Roboto, Open Sans, Lato, Arial, Helvetica, system-ui.
   133→
   134→| App Character | Recommended Fonts |
   135→|--------------|-------------------|
   136→| Data/Analytics | Space Grotesk, IBM Plex Sans, Geist |
   137→| Fitness/Health | Outfit, Nunito Sans, DM Sans |
   138→| Finance | Source Serif 4, Newsreader, IBM Plex Serif |
   139→| Creative | Syne, Bricolage Grotesque, Cabinet Grotesk |
   140→| Professional | Source Sans 3, Plus Jakarta Sans, Manrope |
   141→
   142→Typography hierarchy through extreme weight differences (300 vs 700) and size jumps (24px vs 14px).
   143→
   144→**Colors must be oklch() functions:**
   145→```css
   146→--primary: oklch(0.52 0.22 264);   /* ✅ */
   147→--primary: 0.52 0.22 264;          /* ❌ breaks! */
   148→```
   149→
   150→### Layout: Visual Interest Required
   151→
   152→Every layout needs variation — size, weight, spacing, format, typography. If everything is the same size in identical cards, it's AI slop.
   153→
   154→**Mobile:** Vertical flow, thumb-friendly, hero dominates first viewport.
   155→**Desktop:** Use horizontal space, multi-column where appropriate, hover reveals.
   156→
   157→---
   158→
   159→## Critical Implementation Rules
   160→
   161→### Type Imports
   162→```typescript
   163→// ❌ WRONG
   164→import { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   165→// ✅ CORRECT
   166→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   167→```
   168→
   169→### extractRecordId Null Check
   170→```typescript
   171→const id = extractRecordId(record.fields.relation);
   172→if (!id) return;
   173→```
   174→
   175→### Dates Without Seconds
   176→```typescript
   177→const dateForAPI = formData.date + 'T12:00'; // YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM only
   178→```
   179→
   180→### Select Never Empty Value
   181→```typescript
   182→// ❌ <SelectItem value="">None</SelectItem>
   183→// ✅ <SelectItem value="none">None</SelectItem>
   184→```
   185→
   186→---
   187→
   188→## Completeness Checklist
   189→
   190→### Theme
   191→- [ ] Font loaded via @import url() in index.css (FIRST, before tailwindcss!)
   192→- [ ] Font is NOT from forbidden list
   193→- [ ] All CSS variables are oklch() functions
   194→- [ ] Color palette fits the app's domain
   195→
   196→### Core Component
   197→- [ ] Interactive component implements the chosen UI paradigm
   198→- [ ] Users can create, edit, delete directly from the dashboard
   199→- [ ] Component takes significant screen space (hero element)
   200→
   201→### Technical
   202→- [ ] `npm run build` passes
   203→- [ ] All states handled: loading (Skeleton), empty, error
   204→- [ ] No hardcoded demo data
   205→- [ ] Responsive: mobile and desktop layouts
   206→
   207→---
   208→
   209→## Living Apps API Reference
   210→
   211→### Date Formats (STRICT!)
   212→
   213→| Field Type | Format | Example |
   214→|------------|--------|---------|
   215→| `date/date` | `YYYY-MM-DD` | `2025-11-06` |
   216→| `date/datetimeminute` | `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` | `2025-11-06T12:00` |
   217→
   218→NO seconds for `datetimeminute`!
   219→
   220→### applookup Fields
   221→
   222→Store full URLs: `https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}`
   223→
   224→```typescript
   225→import { extractRecordId, createRecordUrl } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   226→import { APP_IDS } from '@/types/app';
   227→
   228→const recordId = extractRecordId(record.fields.category);
   229→if (!recordId) return;
   230→
   231→const data = { category: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.CATEGORIES, selectedId) };
   232→```
   233→
   234→### API Response Format
   235→
   236→Returns **object**, NOT array. Use `Object.entries()` to extract `record_id`.
   237→
   238→---
   239→
   240→## Data Fetching Pattern
   241→
   242→```typescript
   243→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   244→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   245→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   246→
   247→function Dashboard() {
   248→  const [data, setData] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
   249→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   250→  const [error, setError] = useState<Error | null>(null);
   251→
   252→  useEffect(() => {
   253→    async function fetchData() {
   254→      try {
   255→        const result = await LivingAppsService.getWorkouts();
   256→        setData(result);
   257→      } catch (err) {
   258→        setError(err instanceof Error ? err : new Error('Unknown error'));
   259→      } finally {
   260→        setLoading(false);
   261→      }
   262→    }
   263→    fetchData();
   264→  }, []);
   265→
   266→  if (loading) return <LoadingState />;
   267→  if (error) return <ErrorState error={error} />;
   268→  if (data.length === 0) return <EmptyState />;
   269→
   270→  return <DashboardContent data={data} />;
   271→}
   272→```
   273→
   274→## Relationship Handling (applookup)
   275→
   276→```typescript
   277→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   278→
   279→const exerciseMap = useMemo(() => {
   280→  const map = new Map<string, Exercise>();
   281→  exercises.forEach(ex => map.set(ex.record_id, ex));
   282→  return map;
   283→}, [exercises]);
   284→
   285→const enriched = useMemo(() => {
   286→  return workouts.map(w => {
   287→    const id = extractRecordId(w.fields.exercise);
   288→    return { ...w, exercise: id ? exerciseMap.get(id) : null };
   289→  });
   290→}, [workouts, exerciseMap]);
   291→```
   292→
   293→## Chart Pattern (recharts)
   294→
   295→```typescript
   296→import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
   297→
   298→<ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height={300}>
   299→  <LineChart data={data}>
   300→    <XAxis dataKey="name" stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
   301→    <YAxis stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
   302→    <Tooltip contentStyle={{ backgroundColor: 'var(--background)', border: '1px solid var(--border)' }} />
   303→    <Line type="monotone" dataKey="value" stroke="var(--primary)" strokeWidth={2} dot={false} />
   304→  </LineChart>
   305→</ResponsiveContainer>
   306→```
   307→
   308→## Available Libraries
   309→
   310→- **shadcn/ui** — all components in `src/components/ui/`
   311→- **recharts** — LineChart, BarChart, PieChart, AreaChart
   312→- **lucide-react** — icons
   313→- **date-fns** — date formatting with `de` locale
   314→
   315→## Date Formatting
   316→
   317→```typescript
   318→import { format, parseISO, formatDistance } from 'date-fns';
   319→import { de } from 'date-fns/locale';
   320→
   321→format(parseISO(record.createdat), 'dd.MM.yyyy', { locale: de });
   322→formatDistance(parseISO(record.createdat), new Date(), { addSuffix: true, locale: de });
   323→```
   324→
   325→## Number Formatting
   326→
   327→```typescript
   328→function formatNumber(value: number | null | undefined): string {
   329→  if (value == null) return '-';
   330→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE').format(value);
   331→}
   332→
   333→function formatCurrency(value: number | null | undefined): string {
   334→  if (value == null) return '-';
   335→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', { style: 'currency', currency: 'EUR' }).format(value);
   336→}
   337→```
   338→
